column4: I have an issue. Just recently when I reboot or shut down and start up again I can't use my keyboard or mouse for about 2 minutes. This creates a problem for me since I can't choose what OS to boot into. This is something that just happen very recently and both the keyboard and mouse was working find for years. Any ideas? Thanks
so you cant use them even if you are in grub?
can you use your keyboard BEFORE you get to grub... e.g. to get to BIOS?
do you have an usb or PS2 keyboard at hand for testing?
so the wireless keyboard adapter is unplugged, the other keyboard is mounted and still the problem appears?
Can you think of any reason that this just recently occured? I mean it was working fine for years.
first shot would be: it's old
do you also have a ps/2 keyboard for testing?
the keyboard(s) are?
hm
hm, i don't know any further... try unplug as much as possible and only leave the keyboard on
maybe some connector or somethings blocks a fast hardware recognition
no ps/2 bk for testing :( i don't even  think this PC has a ps/2 port. lol  been awhile since i looked behind my PC though. OK I will try that. Thanks
ok
i don't think that problem is software related
I didn't either
because the problem come BEFORE any operation system can work
exactly
soo.. hope i don't see you here anymore then ;)
maybe with an other problem :D
happended to everybody here once :)
